FuncDef:
The undo ssh user command deletes an SSH user.
The undo ssh user assign command deletes the binding between an SSH user and a public key.
The undo ssh user authentication-type command deletes the configured authentication mode.
The undo ssh user service-type command restores the default service type of an SSH user.
The undo ssh user sftp-directory command cancels the authorized SFTP service directory for an SSH user.
By default, no public key is assigned to the user, no ssh user is created.
CLIs: undo ssh user <user-name> assign { rsa-key | dsa-key | ecc-key | sm2-key }

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the name of an SSH user.
The value is a string of 1 to 253 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Indicates the type of a key.
The supported types of the key are as following:rsa-key

dsa-keyecc-keysm2-key

Indicates the type of an authentication.
-

Indicates the type of a service.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
You can create an SSH user, assign a public key to the user, configure the authentication type and service type for the SSH user, and configure an authorized SFTP service directory for the SSH user.
